column4: hey, i think upgrading from Hardy to Intrepid server changed how BIND9 reads its config files. Anyway, i was wondering if anyone had a link to an up to date tutorial for how to set up BIND9 for a home network
My ISP's DNS isn't that great, which is why I use BIND9 to grab DNS entries from the root servers directly
oh, i guess you couldn't use /etc/hosts for that - maybe it's time to find a new ISP?
lol, ISPs great otherwise. and i'm in Canada, not much choice in ISPs
